Activities / Project

Minispec Visualizer

Winter 2020 - Now

Minispec Visualizer is a program that visualizes Hardware Description Language code (Minispec) into a schematic circuit with options to choose multiple depths of circuit visualization, varying from gate level to top-module behavioral level.

Released as a part of Minispec open-source repository and used in 6.004 Computational Structures course's infrastructure to facilitate students in learning about hardware architecture.

redirect ( "github.mit.edu/boomzaza/
minispec/tree/visualizer" );

Arduino Human Pitch Detection

Spring 2022

Embedded an algorithm to detect human's singing pitch onto ESP32 Arduino board using modified SWIPE pitch detection algorithm

The systems uses multiple signal processing techniques such as Short-time Fast Fourier Transform and Cepstral Analysis to accurately estimate the pitch of the sounds under moderate level of noise.

Chladni Wave Resonance Simulator

Fall 2021

Programmed a wave propagation simulation to visualize the Chladni standing wave pattern on any free-form mesh

The simulation involves multiple numerical analysis techniques such as RK4 Integrator and Laplace-Beltrami operator, and are rendered using custom vertex and fragment shader from C++ OpenGL API.

Battlecode Competition

Winter 2021

Battlecode is a real-time strategy game, for which competitors write an AI player to strategically manage a robot army and control how robots work together to defeat the enemy team.

The AI player involved message-efficient distributed communication protocol for different entity on the board to cooperate and strategically win against the opponent.

watch ( "some of our Battlecode matches" , our_team = "Dis Team" );

Journext: Travel planning website

Winter 2020

A travel planning website that merges map, flight, hotels, and calendar into one web app.

Users can plan their travel on a calendar as well as look at locations of multiple tourists spot simultaneously, allowing users to visualize their travle plan more vividly.

Created with React.js and KonvaJS using geolocation data from OpenStreetMap API

try_out ( "journext.herokuapp.com" );

Competitive Programming

Summer 2019

- Participated in the 2nd round of Facebook Hacker Cup 2019 and placed in the TOP 500 using C++ code only.

- Received 15th place among 13885 competitors on Codeforces competition round #569 (Division 2)

- Participated in the 2nd round of Google Codejam 2019.

Work Experiences

Teaching and laboratory assistant

Massachusetts Institute of Technology

Spring 2019 - Spring 2023

Provided 20-25 hours per week both in person and online (Piazza) to teach students about the design of digital systems and the fundamental computer architecture.

Next Generation System Internship

Inkbit Corporation

Summer 2022 - Fall 2022

Applied reinforcement learning techniques to improve printing resolution of a Vision-controlled Jetting 3D printer, which is one of the 3D printing techniques that provide the highest dimensional accuracy.

The agent is able to detect and tolerate systematic errors in the printing process including ink ejections variability and scanning image misalignment.

Full-stack internship

Tencent (Thailand) Company Ltd.

Summer 2021

Created a hybrid machine learning model for automatic unsupervised text clustering especially about news.

Develop automated incremental news scraping and machine learning training pipeline to integrate into the continuous deployment cycle.

Data scientist internship

Siam Commercial Bank Public Company Ltd.

Summer 2020

Developed a machine learning model for Chatbot's text classification in Thai language, which specializes in classifying finance-related intents from the input text.

The model achieved at least 20% higher accuracy compared to the Dialogflow chatbot agent counterpart.

Software developer internship

Siam Filter Products Ltd.

Summer 2019

Developed SQL database management GUI and framework using .NET Framework C# to provide flexible data organization for the company.

Enabled synchronization of existing data using Micorsoft Azure SQL database.

Co-founder

Nerdy Nite educational program

Summer 2018

Nerdy Nite is an educational program that aims to provide a discussion-based learning environment in Thailand about human rights and related topics.

Helped incorporate the use of a web-based discussion tracker to analyze on how students are participating in discussions.
